New Records: India scored the second-highest T20I score (297/6), three runs short of 300
India hit 22 sixes, joint-highest for a Test-playing side
18 overs went for ten runs or more, a record
Three bowlers conceded 50 or more runs
Key Match Events: Abhishek Sharma's dismissal by Tanzim Hasan
The 173-run second-wicket stand between Samson and Suryakumar
Riyan Parag and Hardik Pandya's 81-run partnership
Usually you expect a bit of relief when you break such a long stand, but Riyan Parag and Hardik Pandya had other ideas
Two wickets in the final over made sure India didn't get to 300
Mahmudullah's last outing in T20 international at 8 off 9
Towhid Hridoy's half-century with a strike rate of 150
Post-Match Reflections: Sanju Samson's talent had yet to translate into numbers in international T20s
For a change, Suryakumar had to be content with being the support act in the 173-run second-wicket stand
It was a monkey off the back for Samson, whose talent had yet to translate into numbers in international T20s
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch played a role in some of the lengths that were let by Rishad Hossain
Bangladesh's biggest loss in terms of runs
Others: The match was played in Hyderabad
The match was the 3rd T20I of Bangladesh's tour of India
The match was played on October 12, 2024
The match was powered by Smart Stats
The match ended with India winning by 133 runs
The match report was written by Sidharth Monga
